# NSItemBadge

**Structure**

`NSItemBadge` represents a badge that can be attached to an `NSToolbarItem`.

## Declaration

```swift
struct NSItemBadge
```

## Overview

This badge provides a way to display small visual indicators, such as counts and text labels, within a toolbar item. Badges can be used to highlight important information, such as unread notifications or status indicators.

## Instance Properties

- **text**: The text to be displayed within the badge.

## Type Properties

- **indicator**: Creates a badge styled as an indicator. In this context, an indicator is simply a badge without any text.

## Type Methods

- **count(_:)**: Creates a badge displaying a localized numerical count.
- **text(_:)**: Creates a badge displaying a text.

## Getting the item’s configuration

- **isVisible**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the item is currently visible in the toolbar, and not in the overflow menu.
- **isHidden**
- **isBordered**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the toolbar item has a bordered style.
- **isNavigational**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the item behaves as a navigation item in the toolbar.
- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the item is enabled.
- **badge**: A badge that can be attached to an NSToolbarItem. This provides a way to display small visual indicators that can be used to highlight important information, such as unread notifications or status indicators.
- **style**: Defines the toolbar item’s appearance. The default style is plain. Prominent style tints the background. If a background tint color is set, it uses it; otherwise, it uses the app’s or system’s accent color. If grouped with other items, it moves to its own to avoid tinting other items’ background.
- **NSToolbarItem.Style**
- **visibilityPriority**: The display priority associated with the toolbar item.
- **NSToolbarItem.VisibilityPriority**: Constants that indicate which toolbar items to keep in the toolbar when space is limited.
- **tag**: An integer tag you can use to identify the toolbar item.

## Conforms To
